item.title: Why is this the answer?
item.description: In my previous post I showed that the minimum inverse-probability weight in a simple random sample should be equal to the response rate of the survey. However, since simple random samples are basically non-existent in the real world, I need to work out the equivalent constraint for complex survey designs. This post summarizes my progress so far towards doing that. In the previous post I speculated that the constraint for \(i\)â€™s weight should be:
